alert.note: Alert for Dolores; San Miguel (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 21 at 3:45PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM MDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Minor flooding caused by reservoir releases. * WHERE...Portions of western Colorado including, Dolores, Montezuma, San Miguel and Montrose Counties. * WHEN...Until 600 PM MDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying areas is possible, including inundated campgrounds and parking lots near river banks. Expect high water levels and fast currents along the Dolores. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 341 PM MDT, reports indicate areas of minor flooding are ongoing or are expected to redevelop through early to midweek. Conditions may change based on updates to reservoir levels over the next couple days. - River conditions and hazards may change rapidly. There may be dangerous unreported hazards, including, but not limited to, low overhanging bridges, and debris (logs and sticks) that can create strainers. Eddies and slackwater become limited at these high water levels. Whitewater rafting and river sports are inherently dangerous activities. Please stay up to date on current and forecast river conditions, as well as, potential closures. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Slick Rock and Bedrock. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
